article.title: Motivic Landweber Exact Theories and Étale Cohomology

multiple_choice_question.text: Which formula describes the exponent of the multiplicative group of units of the cyclic group Z/ν for a prime number  and ν ≥ 1?

What does the following formula represent: StabX(M) := colim M
−⊗X
−→ M
−⊗X
−→ M
−⊗X
−→ · · · ?
choices: The τ-sheafification of a presheaf F.
The slice completion of an E-module M.
The stabilization of an object M with respect to an n-symmetric object X.
The homotopy presheaf of a motivic spectrum E.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which formula defines the α-inversion x[α⁻¹] of an object x in a presentably symmetric monoidal ∞-category, where α: y → m is a map from an ⊗-invertible object y?
choices: x[α⁻¹] := lim x \nα· → y⁻¹ ⊗ x \nid⊗α· → y⁻¹ ⊗ y⁻¹ ⊗ x  · · ·
x[α⁻¹] := colim x \nα· → y⁻¹ ⊗ x \nid⊗α· → y⁻¹ ⊗ y⁻¹ ⊗ x  · · ·

x[α⁻¹] := colim m 
α∗
→ map(x, m) 
α∗
→ map(x, map(x, m))  map(x⊗², m) · · ·

x[α⁻¹] := lim m 
α∗
→ map(x, m) 
α∗
→ map(x, map(x, m))  map(x⊗², m) · · ·

multiple_choice_question.text:
In the context of algebraic cobordism, what does the following formula compute: 
Qαm := colim m 
α∗
→ map(x, m) 
α∗
→ map(x, map(x, m))  map(x⊗², m) · · · ?
choices: The τ-localization of a motivic spectrum.
The slice cover of a motivic spectrum.
The α-periodization of an object m in a presentably symmetric monoidal ∞-category.
